title: Zahid Hasan Ameli
text:
Zahid Hasan Ameli (; born 25 December 1987) is a Bangladeshi <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a> for <a href="Brothers%20Union">Brothers Union</a> and the <a href="Bangladesh%20national%20football%20team">Bangladesh national team</a>. He is the current second top scorer of the <a href="Bangladesh%20national%20football%20team">Bangladesh national football team</a> and also has the most caps.
Club career.
From 2007 to 2009, Ameli played for Dhaka side <a href="Abahani%20Limited%20%28Dhaka%29">Abahani Limited</a> where he scored a total of 25 league goals, helping the club win back-to-back <a href="Bangladesh%20Premier%20League%20%28football%29">B. League</a> titles. He then moved to another Dhaka side, <a href="Mohammedan%20Sporting%20Club%20%28Dhaka%29">Mohammedan Sport Club</a> for the 2009–10 season where he scored 18 goals as the club finished league runners-up. Before the start of the 2010–11 season, he transferred to <a href="Sheikh%20Jamal%20Dhanmondi%20Club">Sheikh Jamal Dhanmondi Club</a>. They eventually won the <a href="2010-11%20Bangladesh%20League">league</a> title. Later he joined <a href="Muktijoddha%20Sangsad%20KS">Muktijoddha Sangsad KS</a> in 2011–12 season; his team became <a href="2011-12%20Bangladesh%20Premier%20League">Premier League</a> runner-up. He joined <a href="Sheikh%20Russel%20KC">Sheikh Russel KC</a> in 2012 and led his team to <a href="Federation%20Cup%20%28Bangladesh%29">Federation Cup (Bangladesh)</a> title by scoring 8 goals in the tournament.
Honours.
Brothers Union
Abahani Limited 
Mohammedan SC
Sheikh Russel KC
Sheikh Jamal Dhanmondi Club
Chittagong Abahani
Bangladesh U-23
Gold medal (1): <a href="2010%20South%20Asian%20Games">2010</a>
